content.question: If <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the vector-valued function defined by <math alttext="f of t, equals, open angled bracket, open parenthesis, t squared, plus t, close parenthesis, cubed, comma, open parenthesis, t to the fourth power, plus t, close parenthesis, to the fifth power, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>t</mi><msup><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>t</mi><msup><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="f prime of t, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.4: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
